results.title: Cost, profit & break-even (NP)
results.brief_description: John Cleese is joined by John Bird who explains to him why his factory which produces coupled cutlery has gone bankrupt. The film is designed to show the influence of the cost of a product on its price and how the volume produced affects that cost. Also considers how productivity is the only way to increase wages without increasing inflation. Intended for line managers, senior executives and personnel not directly concerned with finance. Suitable for upper secondary level. NB: FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

results.title: Cosmic zoom
results.creator_credit: Robert Verrall, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: Probes the infinite magnitude of space, and its reverse, the ultimate minuteness of matter. Animation art and animation camera achieve this journey to the farthest conceivable point of the universe and then into the tiniest particle of existence - an atom of a living cell - with freshness and clarity that would seem impossible with other means of exposition. (Awards: Bilbao, Buenos Aires, Philadelphia, Berlin)

results.title: Cosmic zoom
results.brief_description:
From the top of the Empire State Building to the edge of the known universe, this breath-taking three-minute video animation sequence was produced for a television documentary series. Using spatial data over a huge range of scales, the sequence was produced using six different renderers, developed specially to deal with planetary surfaces, atmospheres, stars, individual galaxies and groups of galaxies. Aerial photography was combined with high-resolution and global satellite imagery of the Earth. Planetary imagemaps of the Moon, Mars and Saturn were developed from the Clementine, Viking and Voyager missions. The rings of Saturn were derived from Voyager’s occultation experiment and Voyager itself is depicted as a 3D model heading up out of the plane of the solar system. The nearest stars are portrayed with their correct relative positions, magnitude and colour, extracted from astronomical catalogues.

The only object not based directly on scientific observations is our own Milky Way galaxy, half of which is obscured from view from Earth by the dense galactic nucleus. Our galaxy and the neighbouring Andromeda galaxy were rendered using specially-written software which models the 3D distribution of tens of millions of individual stars and clouds of light-blocking dust, using telescopic images as a template. These and the other galaxies were portrayed in their correct relative positions, size, morphological type and dominant colour. By the end of the sequence we are looking back, across chains and walls of galaxies, from the edge of the known universe.

results.title: Cosmic rays
results.creator_credit: Stanley Ruttenberg, Hugh Odishaw, Lothar Wolff and National Academy of Sciences (U.S.)
results.brief_description: Deals with the radiations observed on earth and first identified early in this century as a phenomenon originating in outer space. Current concepts of their origin are presented and their study related to other fields of scientific research, such as atomic and nuclear physics.

results.title: Cosi Fan Tutte [Australian Opera]
results.brief_description: Mozart’s classic comedy is performed at the Victorian Arts Centre, March 28, 1990 as part of the ‘Esso night at the opera’ series. Cast includes Yvonne Kenny, David Hobson, Fiona Janes, Jeffrey Black, Rosamund Illing and John Pringle. In Italian with English sub-titles, music conducted by Peter Robinson.

results.title: Cosi Fan Tutte
results.brief_description: The Swedish conductor Arnold Ostman collaborates with German producer Willy Decker on this ever popular Mozart comedy with an extensively rehearsed cast of young Swedish singers. The setting is the immaculately restored 18th century Drottningholm Court Theatre at the country residence of the Swedish Royal Family.

results.title: Cosi
results.creator_credit: Mark Joffe, Timothy White, Richard Brennan, Meridian Films and Smiley Film
results.brief_description: Lewis (Ben Mendelsohn) is a uni drop-out who takes a last-ditch job in an asylum working with patients who are interested in the dramatic arts. He thinks his work will involve staging a small variety show with the group, until long-term patient, Roy, insists that the production be nothing less than a grand staging of Mozart’s opera Cosi Fan Tutte. It’s an ambitious thought to say the least. After all, none of the patients can speak Italian nor sing and the cast is made up of aging nymphomaniacs, obsessives and pyromaniacs who really have other things on their minds. Funny, warm and wonderfully mad, this is one production that’s definitely all there, even if the cast isn’t.

results.title: Cortege of Eagles (TEFC)
results.brief_description: One of a group of modern dances created by Martha Graham. A creative ballet representing her mature creative work. The story is set in Ancient Troy at the time of its fall. When Hecuba, portrayed by Martha Graham, is faced with the inevitable consequence of the violent times, she herself is driven to terrible violence. Music composed and conducted by Eugene Lester: setting by Isamu Noguchi.

results.title: Correspondences: Víctor Erice and Abbas Kiarostami [exhibition]: archival material
results.brief_description:
“Correspondences” was an ACMI Screen Gallery Exhibition, held 21 August 2008 - 2 November 2008.

See Exhibition activity record “Correspondences” (ID 35 ) for more information

Spanish director Víctor Erice’s small but acclaimed body of work has been widely acknowledged for its poetic and masterful storytelling. Iranian filmmaker Abbas Kiarostami is regarded as a master of contemporary world cinema, voted by many critics as the most important director of the nineties.

Although these two great filmmakers met face-to-face only once before this exhibition, they discovered powerful parallels in their interests and ideas. Featuring film, photography and new work created especially for the exhibition, Correspondences represents the long distance creative dialogue and intimate rapport that developed between Erice and Kiarostami.
